acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since its 96h-LC50 = 5.9 mg/L for fish (bluegills) (EHC 78 (1988)), the substance was classified into Category 2.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on its rabbit LD50 = 2000 - 2500 mg/kg (EHC 76 (1988), IARC vol. 30 (1983)), the substance was classified into "Not classified" in JIS classification (equivalent to Category 5 in UN classification).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Its rat LD50 values of 393 - 1000 mg/kg (IARC vol. 30 (1983)) are within the guidance values of Category 4.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Since the substance is rated Group 3 in IARC (IARC Suppl. 7 (1987)), it was classified into "Not classified".

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Its preexisting classification for acute toxicity is Category 2, it is not rapidly biodegradable (SRC: BioWin V4.10) and it is estimated to have high bioconcentration potency (log Pow = 4.49, PHYSPROP Database (2008)), and therefore, the substance was classified into Category 2.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Solid (GHS definition). However, since its melting point is near room temperature, technically, it is dealt with as a liquid. Since its flash point is 77degC (HSDB), the substance was classified into Category 4.

flammable_solids.rationale: Since its flash point is 77degC (HSDB (2003)), the substance was classified into "Not classified".

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification is not possible, due to a lack of in vivo test data. As relevant information, some in vitro mutagenicity tests (Ames test (EHC 76 (1988)), a mutagenicity test using mammalian cells (IARC (vol.30, 1983)), and a chromosomal aberration test using mammalian cells (IARC vol.30) indicated positive results.

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure

oxidizing_solids.rationale: The substance contains oxygen (but not fluorine or chlorine) which is chemically bonded only to carbon or hydrogen.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: It is documented that in a test using rabbits, the substance did not show any teratogenicity (Birth Defects 3rd (2000)). However, since there is no other data available, classification is not possible.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Since its melting point is 25degC, and test methods applicable to solid (melting point <= 140degC) substances are not available, classification is not possible.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups present in the molecule associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Since it was documented that in a test using rabbits, the substance is a moderate irritant to the skin (EHC 76 (1988): The pesticide manual: world compendium, 7th ed., Croydon, British Crop Protection Council), and also in human exposure, its irritation was suggested (HSFS (2004)), the substance was classified into Category 2.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Since it was documented that in a test using rabbits, the substance is a moderate irritant to the skin (EHC 76 (1988): The pesticide manual: world compendium, 7th ed., Croydon, British Crop Protection Council), and also in human exposure, its irritation was suggested (HSFS (2004), HSDB (2003)), the substance was classified into Category 2.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It is documented that in a 90-day oral administration (diet) test using rats, at the dose of 8 mg/kg/day, irritability, hyperactivity, and mild cardiac changes occurred (EHC 76 (1988)). However, since there is no other data available, classification is not possible.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: It is reported that in a rat oral administration test, its effects on the nervous system occurred at high dose levels tested (IARC (vo.12, 1976), EHC 76 (1988)). However, due to a lack of data, the substance was classified into "Classification not possible".
